messages.subject: Fwd: AI that actually learns?
messages.snippet: Perfect outbound email. Might be an interesting prod. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Daniel Kimber <daniel.kimber@openbrainfish.com> Date: Thu, Feb 27, 2025 at 3:04 PM Subject: AI
messages.body:
Perfect outbound email.

Might be an interesting prod.




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Daniel Kimber <daniel.kimber@openbrainfish.com>
Date: Thu, Feb 27, 2025 at 3:04 PM
Subject: AI that actually learns?
To: <hussein@godmodehq.com>


Hi Hussein,

Saw you're building the future of AI-native sales at GodmodeHQ - making
outbound feel like inbound. That's exactly what caught my eye, because
we're tackling a similar challenge in product support.

While you're revolutionizing sales with AI, we're transforming product
support with an ambient AI that actually learns from user behavior - no
training or maintenance needed. Just a few lines of code and it starts
understanding how users interact with your product.

Companies like Smokeball saw their support NPS jump from 60 to 77 with a
92% successful self-service rate. Their support team now focuses on
strategic work instead of repetitive questions.

Want to see how it works?

Thanks,
Daniel

Best,

Agenda - Prep for campaign with Cyber Sainik (https://cybersainik.com/)
Some notes to start the conversation

Campaign Roles and Goals

  *
Mission Cyber Group will act as the VAR and will resell/generate leads for Cyber Sainik's services
  *
Prospect size
     *
1000 or fewer employees
  *
Vertical
     *
Healthcare
     *
Retail
     *
Non profits
     *
Transportation
  *
Location
     *
Pennsylvania
  *

messages.subject: Re: The Ash Design x GodmodeHQ
messages.snippet: Thanks for reaching out! I came across your platform, found it interesting, and decided to sign up. As I started creating my target audience, I went through the process and filled everything out. When
messages.body:
Thanks for reaching out!

I came across your platform, found it interesting, and decided to sign up. As I started creating my target audience, I went through the process and filled everything out. When I clicked “View” to check a potential lead (if I’m using the right term—sorry if I’m mistaken), I reviewed the details and wanted to make a small adjustment.

However, after exiting the onboarding to make the change and clicking “Back,” all the information I had entered was lost, and there was no way to restore it. I had to re-enter everything manually, which made me decide to pause the process. Later, I didn’t get around to continuing.

I hope this feedback is helpful! I’d still love to try using your platform and would be happy to provide more feedback if that would be valuable for you.

Best,

Ella Shteier
The Ash Design
+380 73 456 8700 (WhatsApp)
www.theash.design
On 26 Feb 2025 at 13:26 +0200, Hussein Abou Eita <hussein@godmodehq.com>, wrote:
> Hey, there!
>
> Just checked out your website, super impressive design work.
>
> I saw that you signed up to GodmodeHQ, completed your onboarding and then never loaded a list or set up an associate.
>
> We're redesigning our onboarding, so we'd love to know what happened there.
>
> Would be happy to give you some free credits in exchange for a bit of feedback :)
>
> How does that sound?
>
> Best,
>

messages.body:
Hi Mert,

Thank you for your email and for sharing your decision with us. While we’re
sorry to see you go, we completely understand your position and appreciate
the transparency.

Please consider this confirmation that we have processed your non-renewal

Wishing you and your team continued success as well.

Best regards,
Dorota


Dorota Kowalska

Renewals

Hoping to work together once you reach PMF!

> On 25 Feb 2025, at 15:43, Neville Engineer <neville@rayze.xyz> wrote:
> 
> Hi Mert,
> 
> Thanks for reaching out with another survey.
> 
> To be honest, the most pressing problem I'm currently facing is figuring out how to market my product effectively and reach the right customers. 
>

messages.body:
Thank you Rugved - for your feedback: What specifically about following up with leads is challenging for you? Do you lose them in your inbox after they reply or do you forget about follow ups after the meeting perhaps? 

For mass outreach, definitely recommend Mailchimp as it is a more marketing email rather than sales email, hope this helps. 

> On 24 Feb 2025, at 16:04, Rugved Ambekar <rugved@fraq.com.co> wrote:

It's challenging to get responses and the entire process of warming them up, qualifying them, and securing a discovery call is time-consuming and often frustrating. It seems the only way to make this viable is to try and handle cold lead outreach in MASS - like 1000s of leads per month.. with GodmodeHQ this is impossible without breaking the budget.
> 
> Best,
> Rugved

Hey Mert - got amazing results and response to my latest survey. Hence sending a new one for you. You will get 100 free
leads which is worth $100 if you choose to respond.
 
Just respond to this email with your answer, no surveys, no boring stuff. The more detailed your answer is, the better!
 
Simple question: What is the most pressing problem you have been having (outside of Godmode too)??
 
 1. Following up and converting my existing leads (pipeline)

 1. Managing Linkedin and/or email inbox

 1. Researching my accounts and leads on demand

 1. I hate my CRM

 1. Managing ongoing deals

 1. I don't know how to market my product

 1. Searching for intent signals to find customers

 1. Reaching out to my website visitors

 1. Other: Please specify

 
Mert
